n = int(input())
col_list = list(input().split())
marks_col = col_list.index("MARKS")
marks_list = []
for i in range(n):
    info_list = list(input().split())
    marks_list.append(float(info_list[marks_col]))
print((sum(marks_list)/n))

#!/usr/bin/env python3

from collections import namedtuple

def __starting_point():
    s_num = int(input().strip())
    tuple_fields = input().strip().split()
    
    student = namedtuple('student', tuple_fields)
    library = []
    res = 0
    
    for _ in range(s_num):
        st_info = input().strip().split()
        library.append(student(st_info[0], st_info[1], st_info[2], st_info[3]))
        
    for el in library:
        res += int(el.MARKS)
    
    print(res/s_num)
__starting_point()
